column4: any decent placed to dl the intrepid iso that dont fail during the last minutes repeatedly
I dont use torrents
then make sure you md5 it after downloading to make sure it was done
and maybe use a downloading client which can resume downloads in case it stops
there are thousands of mirrors, just because one (or maybe your own connection) isn't good is a stupid reason to blame Ubuntu for having a download link on their site
I have tried two different cable connections and one dsl and half a dozen sites .
and it has nothing to do with ubuntu, and everything to do with the different mirror hosting sites
we are offtopoic.. I choose NOT to use the torrents
be very careful when giving out the force command that you include a path after it.. If yo pass the wrong thing to a beginner they wont know and can erase everything
kk, that's why i didn't include a path behind it ;)
include something like /path/filename  just so they know
i'll keep it in mind hehe
Very low tollerance for anyone writing that command unclearly or wrong..

yeah i've noticed the op's here are quite touchy on things like that.. been trying to better myself but it's hard to keep in mind some people are really, really new to this.. i still consider myself a noob ;)
and we appreciate your help in here
just enjoying the channel, only been here 1.5 days now and feeling right at home :)
what are the specs?
it's for a laptop i got for free from a friend.. 500mhz with 256MB lol.. just use it for surfing on the couch ;)
That will run ubuntu fine as long as you minimize how much ram is shared with video
Xubuntu would be my choice
i currently run debian lenny with lxde/openbox on it
